murals.title: Balloon Girl
murals.description: Iconic Banksy artwork depicting a girl reaching for a balloon.

murals.title: Obey Mural
murals.description: Shepard Fairey's signature Obey Giant mural conveying political messages.

murals.title: Subway Dreaming
murals.description: Swoon's intricate wheatpaste art featuring dreamlike scenes on abandoned buildings.

murals.title: Inside Out Project
murals.description: JR's large-scale portraits pasted on buildings, part of the Inside Out Project.

murals.title: The Unbound
murals.description: Faith47's mural exploring themes of freedom and unity.

murals.title: Space Invader
murals.description: Invader's pixelated mosaic featuring a space invader character.

murals.title: Queens Connection
murals.description: Lady Pink's vibrant mural celebrating the cultural diversity of Queens.

murals.title: Love and Death
murals.description: D*Face's mural exploring the theme of love and mortality.

murals.title: Wildlife Harmony
murals.description: ROA's large-scale mural featuring intricately detailed wildlife.

murals.title: Crocheted Cosmos
murals.description: Olek's unique crocheted artwork covering an entire building facade.

murals.title: Unity
murals.description: Stik's minimalist mural promoting unity and inclusivity.

murals.title: Robot Lady of Leisure
murals.description: Pixel Pancho's robotic-themed mural blending nature and machinery.

murals.title: Transparent Layers
murals.description: Borondo's layered and transparent mural exploring depth and perception.

murals.title: Harlem Portrait
murals.description: El Mac's realistic portrait capturing the spirit of Harlem.

murals.title: Cosmic Wave
murals.description: Dasic Fernandez's vibrant cosmic wave mural in LIC.

murals.title: Urban Stories
murals.description: Alice Pasquini's narrative-driven mural reflecting urban stories.

murals.title: Coney Island Grinnies
murals.description: Happiness sticks to your face! And ecstasy peels it right off! The idea of the grinnie treatment is to illustrate how the expression of happiness inadvertently reveals the soul.

location.intersection: Stillwell Ave between Neptune Ave & Mermaid Ave

murals.title: Dreamscape
murals.description: Seeing Os Gemeos' mural on Stillwell Avenue alone is worth a trip to Coney Island. Painted in 2005 and located just outside the subway exit, it continues to attract art tourists and local visitors. The Brazilian graffiti artists, twin brothers Otavio and Gustavo Pandolfo, were sponsored by Creative Timeâ€™s Dreamland Artist Club for this project, but their creative reach has expanded exponentially in the last decade.

murals.title: unknown
murals.description: This mural by portuguese artist Vhils is his first in the US. His portraits are chiseled into plaster and brick walls. This is a portrait of artist TJ Mizell.

murals.title: Hammer Boy
murals.description: This modest stencil piece on the Upper West Side is still intact, thanks to the building owner, who installed a Plexiglas shield in an act of guerilla art preservation.

murals.title: unknown
murals.description: Spread Art NYC, led by Naofal Alaoui (aka Rocko), helped bring this calligraffiti mural to life in 2015, located across from 247 Troutman Street. Working with Joel Bergner (aka Joel Artista), the two executed a mural based on an ongoing portrait series by acclaimed photographer and cinematographer Barron Claiborne

murals.title: The Day After
murals.description: A street art work by How and Nosm (Raoul and Davide Perre) identical twin brothers known for their large scale graffiti based murals that adorn city walls around the world.

murals.title: Story of My Life
murals.description: Logan Hicks intricately weaves a captivating narrative of urban living, blending realism and abstraction.

murals.title: Melty World
murals.description: Brooklyn's power-pink street artist Buff Monster is well known around the City for his colorful and detailed murals depicting cute one-eyed monsters and melty elements.

murals.title: Untitled
murals.description: Blending themes of morbid corporeality with the colorful, hyper-loony aesthetic descended from comics and cartoons, Nychos has developed a unique style that performs with powerhouse effect whether on the street or in the gallery.

murals.title: Hercules at the Crossroads
murals.description: Iâ€™ve chosen to recreate an allegory painted many times during the Renaissance: Hercules at the Crossroads. Traditionally, Hercules is placed in the middle; on the left is a life of virtue (represented by a treacherous mountains) and a life of sin and unhealthy choices on the right (represented by lakes and wooded areas). IÂ¹ve maintained the positions of the different paths, but inverted the imagery because I think living an honest life can be easy and appealing. In the painting we see that Hercules is right in the process of making that choice: heÂ¹s looking towards the sweet side while his spear creates a visual barrier to the unhealthy side. I think the scene also relates perfectly to Coney Island Art Walls project; celebrating the possibilities of new development over the run-down norm. - Buff Monster

comments.text: Absolutely captivating! Banksy's art always speaks volumes.
comments.author: ArtEnthusiast23

comments.text: The symbolism behind Balloon Girl is both poignant and beautiful.
comments.author: UrbanExplorer

comments.text: Shepard Fairey's political murals are a powerful form of expression.
comments.author: PoliticalArtCritic

comments.text: Obey Mural stands tall, conveying a strong and thought-provoking message.
comments.author: VisualActivist

comments.text: Swoon's wheatpaste art on Troutman St is like stepping into a dream.
comments.author: DreamSeeker

comments.text: Subway Dreaming by Swoon adds a touch of magic to Bushwick's streets.
comments.author: LocalArtFanatic

comments.text: JR's Inside Out Project celebrates the diversity of DUMBO.
comments.author: CommunityHarmony

comments.text: ROA's Wildlife Harmony is like a detailed encyclopedia of the natural world.
comments.author: NatureLover

comments.text: Wildlife Harmony by ROA brings the Brooklyn Navy Yard to life with intricate details.
comments.author: WildlifeExplorer

comments.text: Olek's Crocheted Cosmos is a true masterpiece of unique artistic expression.

comments.author: UnityAdvocate

comments.text: The simplicity of Stik's mural in Allen St is a beautiful representation of unity.
comments.author: SimpleArtLover

comments.text: Pixel Pancho's Mechanical Nature blends the organic and the mechanical seamlessly.
comments.author: TechArtEnthusiast

comments.text: Mechanical Nature is a testament to Pixel Pancho's unique fusion of nature and machinery.

comments.text: Borondo's Transparent Layers mural at Van Brunt St is a mesmerizing play of depth.

comments.text: El Mac's Harlem Portrait captures the spirit of East Harlem with impressive realism.
comments.author: HarlemSpiritObserver

comments.text: Harlem Portrait by El Mac is a stunning portrayal of the local community's essence.
comments.author: RealismAppreciator

comments.text: Dasic Fernandez's Cosmic Wave brings vibrant energy to Long Island City.

comments.text: Cosmic Wave is a testament to Dasic Fernandez's mastery of color and movement.

comments.text: Alice Pasquini's Urban Stories mural narrates the tales of East Village's streets.
comments.author: UrbanStoryteller

comments.text: Urban Stories by Alice Pasquini is a beautiful narrative woven into the city walls.
comments.author: NarrativeArtFan

comments.text: Ron English's 'Coney Island Grinnies' is a joyful masterpiece! The concept of portraying happiness and its connection to the soul is both thought-provoking and visually delightful. Kudos to the artist for spreading positivity through art.
comments.author: SmileSeeker99

comments.text: The 'Coney Island Grinnies' mural by Ron English is a brilliant representation of the complexity of human emotions. The use of vibrant colors and the playful depiction of happiness make this piece a standout in Coney Island. Ron English's creativity is truly captivating!
comments.author: HumorArtAppreciator

comments.text: Os Gemeos' Dreamscape on Coney Island is a surreal journey in street art.
comments.author: DreamscapeExplorer

comments.text: Dreamscape by Os Gemeos is a timeless masterpiece in the heart of Brooklyn.
comments.author: TimelessArtLover

comments.text: Vhils' chiseled mural in Little Italy is a unique portrait of artist TJ Mizell.
comments.author: ChiseledPortraitsFan

comments.text: Vhils' unknown portrait is a captivating addition to the artistic scene in Little Italy.
comments.author: ArtMysteryEnthusiast

comments.text: Banksy's Hammer Boy on the Upper West Side is a modest yet impactful stencil piece.
comments.author: StencilArtAdmirer

comments.text: Hammer Boy by Banksy remains intact, a testament to guerilla art preservation.
comments.author: PreservationistArtLover

comments.text: This mural is a vibrant masterpiece! The use of colors is mesmerizing, and the calligraffiti technique adds a unique touch. Kudos to Rocko & Joel Artista for creating such a captivating piece of art.
comments.author: ArtLover87

comments.text: I love the connection between the mural and the photographer's portrait series. It's incredible how art can bring different forms of creativity together. The location in Bushwick makes it a standout piece in Brooklyn. Great collaboration by Rocko & Joel Artista!
comments.author: UrbanExplorer23

comments.text: The Day After by How & Nosm on E Houston St is a graffiti-based masterpiece with a powerful impact.
comments.author: GraffitiArtAficionado

comments.text: The Day After is an intriguing display of How & Nosm's unique graffiti style.
comments.author: UrbanExpressionist

comments.text: Logan Hicks' Story of My Life intricately narrates the urban labyrinth at E Houston St.
comments.author: UrbanLabyrinthStoryteller

comments.text: Story of My Life is a captivating blend of realism and abstraction, a Logan Hicks trademark.
comments.author: RealismAbstractionAdmirer

comments.text: Buff Monster's Melty World in Lower East Side is a delightful burst of color and cuteness.
comments.author: MeltyWorldEnthusiast

comments.text: Melty World showcases Buff Monster's talent in bringing cute monsters and melty elements to life.
comments.author: CutenessArtLover

comments.text: Buff Monster's Renaissance twist sparks imagination! Coney Island's rebirth amplifies the mural's charm. Kudos to Buff Monster's vibrant ingenuity!
comments.author: ImaginationSeeker

comments.text: Buff Monster's mural unveils potent symbols. Hercules leans toward sweetness, mirroring life's pivotal choices. Coney Island's evolution echoes positive transformations. Thoughtful and inspiring!
comments.author: MindfulObserver
